Package GUI

Class ConditionJPanel

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
GUI.ConditionJPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class ConditionJPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
The ConditionJPanel class allows the creation of a JPanel (extending JPanel class) with specific features regarding the graphic definition by the user of a condition within a rule: Metric metric that will be used; Numeric operator : EQ; NE; GT; GE; LT; LE; Threshold: Value to compare with. Logical Operator: AND; OR to join between conditions.
Author:
Engenharia de Software - Grupo 11
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • ConditionJPanel

      public ConditionJPanel​(java.lang.String conditionNumber, java.lang.String code_smell)
      This constructor is directed to the introduction of a new condition creating a ConditionJPanel
      Parameters:
      conditionNumber - The number of the condition within the rule
      code_smell - The code smell associated to the rule

    • ConditionJPanel

      public ConditionJPanel​(java.lang.String conditionNumber, java.lang.String s_metric, java.lang.String s_numericOperator, java.lang.String s_threshold, java.lang.String s_logicalOperator, java.lang.String code_smell)
      This constructor is directed to the graphic generation of conditions already existing in the rule creating a ConditionJPanel
      Parameters:
      conditionNumber - The number of the condition within the rule
      s_metric - The metric used to evaluate the result of the code smell detention
      s_numericOperator - The numeric operator that will serve to compare the value of the metric extract form class or method with the value from condition's threshold
      s_threshold - The integer value for comparation
      s_logicalOperator - The logical operator registered between conditions
      code_smell - The code smell associated to the rule

  • Method Details

    • validatePanel

      public boolean validatePanel​(boolean validateLogicalOperator, java.lang.StringBuilder errorMessage, int conditionIndex)
      This method is used to verify if the panel has all of its components: Metric; Numeric Operator; Threshold; Logical Operator filled. In case not, it doesn't allow user to save rule conditions and also displays a error message warning the user to complete the incompleted spaces.
      Parameters:
      validateLogicalOperator - True when rule has more than one condition in order to verify if user filled the space related to Logical Operator; otherwise false
      errorMessage - This is StringBuilder instance to display an error to user advertising for unfilled boxes
      conditionIndex - This is the reference to the condition position in the rule where there are fields incompleted
      Returns:
      boolean This returns true if all components are filled; otherwise, it displays an error message.

    • getConditionAsString

      public java.lang.String getConditionAsString()
      This method is responsible for formatting the fields filled by the user into a custom String with ":" between the different camps.
      Returns:
      This returns a custom String containing the metric choosen; the numeric operator choosen; the threshold input and the Logical Operator

    • getMetricComboBoxIndex

      private int getMetricComboBoxIndex​(java.lang.String metric)
      This method is responsible for setting the metric presented on the condition to the graphic interface (ConditionJPanel) in order to let the user see what metric was selected in that condition in that rule.
      Parameters:
      metric - The String cast of the metric name presented on condition
      Returns:
      This returns a integer to identify the position on JComboBox of the Metric presented on condition

    • getNumericOperatorComboBoxIndex

      private int getNumericOperatorComboBoxIndex​(java.lang.String operator)
      This method is responsible for setting the numeric operator presented on the condition to the graphic interface (ConditionJPanel) in order to let the user see what numeric operator was selected in that condition in that rule.
      Parameters:
      operator - The String cast of the numeric operator presented on condition
      Returns:
      This returns a integer to identify the position on JComboBox of the numeric operator presented on condition

    • getLogicalOperatorComboBoxIndex

      private int getLogicalOperatorComboBoxIndex​(java.lang.String operator)
